item.description:
This screening of the documentary 'The Colour of Water' is organized by the Alliance for a Secular and Democratic South Asia and the Boston-Chhalphal (Nepal). The movie unpacks the facts about Nepal's Himalayan water resources and builds the case against big dams.

The film examines plans to build big dams in Nepal to export hydro-electricity to India and finds that the long-term hidden cost is potentially disastrous for both countries. The 45-min screening will be followed by a discussion on greater regional cooperation for water management throughout South Asia, with a focus on the recently revived River Linking Project in India.

The documentary was produced by Andrew Majewski, who will be present for the screening and the subsequent discussion. Andrew is an independent documentary film-maker and made this movie in partnership with Nepali film-maker Gopal Koirala.
